> Find the driving point impedance seen by the voltage source in Figure P11–3 and the voltage transfer function T_V(s) = V_2(s) / V_1(s).

### Driving point impedans:

Dette er simpelt - hvad er $V_1(s)$ ?

$$
V_1(s)= V_L + V_R + V_C
$$

Omskrevet:

$$
V_1(s)= I(s)\left( L s + R + \frac{1}{Cs}\right)
$$

Dermed:

$$
\frac{V_1(s)}{I(s)}= L s  + R + \frac{1}{Cs}
$$

Omskrevet:

$$
Z(s)=\frac{V_1(s)}{I(s)}= \frac{LCs^2 + RCs +1}{Cs}
$$

### Transfer function:

Da det er en spændingsdeler gælder flg.:

$$
T_V(s)=\frac{R}{Ls + \frac{1}{Cs}+R}
$$

Omskrevet:

$$
T_V(s)=\frac{R}{\frac{LCs^2 + RCs +1}{Cs}}
$$

$$
\boxed{
T_V(s)=\frac{RCs}{LCs^2 + RCs +1}
}
$$
